title: Survey shows a third of men binge drink while away on work trips
text:
2

Business trips are apparently an opportunity for some to let their hair down with a new survey showing many don't keep their time away strictly professional.
In a revelation that may keep some employers up at night, more than a quarter (27 per cent) of employees admitted to binge drinking while working away.
And while at the bar on a company trip, 11 per cent of business travellers revealed they had 'picked someone up'.
In fact, two per cent of males claimed they pick someone up every time they go away.
In addition to this, the survey, conducted by travellers' emergency assistance group On Call International, said that eight per cent of business travellers have lied to their employer about their activities while on a work-related trip.
And four percent have even be held in jail instead of being in a boardroom while away.
It appears that men are more likely to let out some steam while away, as nearly a third (33 per cent) admitted to binge drinking. Women are less likely to hit the bottle, with 24 per cent saying they drank excessively.

The data came from a Google Consumer Survey of more than 1,000 US business travellers.
